column4: Hello everyone, could anybody help me with my problem?  I'm dual-booting Vista and Ubuntu (Feisty), with feisty on an external USB hard drive that is set first in the boot order, so apparently it shows up as hd0.  I can't seem to get Vista to boot.  Any help would be appreciated.
I'm trying to get it to boot in GRUB
I don't really know what "pastebin" is, but I guess I could just do a regular copy-paste
did yo make that entry for vista yourself ?
ok ,  is vista on the first partition of the hdd ?
comment out the rootnoverify line ,  edit map (hd0) (hd1)   , edit  map (hd1) (hd0) , add root (hd1,2) , add savedefault ,   save and try
Okay, I'll try that, thanks, I'll be back shortly with results
the root and savedefault lines come before makeactive , btw
actualy,  baste the final before leaving so I can check
move the root line after the map lines
Ok, I did that, anything else?
aside from that it looks ok
Ok, thanks, I'm going to reboot now
Thanks for the help, it worked perfectly
